name: Pov
header: Pov is a grandmother from Cambodia who needs $225 to treat mature cataracts.
description:
Meet Pov, a 53-year-old woman from Cambodia. “She is married with two children and two grandchildren,” shares our medical partner, Children’s Surgical Centre (CSC).

Pov has mature cataracts in both of her eyes. A cataract is a condition in which there is progressive clouding of the internal lens in the eye. “She has difficulty seeing faces and can’t go anywhere on her own, “ CSC explains. “Her husband can’t do his work well because he constantly has to attend to her.”

$225 will fund the treatment Pov needs to correct her vision. With this funding, Pov will receive cataract surgery—a procedure in which the cloudy lens is removed from her eye and replaced it with a clear lens implant. Without this procedure, Pov is at risk for permanent blindness.

After her recovery, Pov’s vision will be clear and her independence restored.

CSC shares, “Pov is excited to see clearly again, help her husband in the farm, and take care of her grandchildren.
